page.title: 18Conservation along the canal
page.content: Between the sewage works and the M5 motorway lies a conservation area which is owned and managed by the Devon Trust for Nature conservation. The area is on old sludge beds which belonged to the sewage works. It is very rich in nutrients because of this and plants thrive. The trust manages the area, weeding out some species and ensuring that the area is kept wet by leading water from the canal through a pipe. The area has variety of flora including: 2 spieces of willow, waterplantation, water dropwort, nettles and 5 spieces of willow herb. Fauna include: 11 spieces of dragon fly, 4 spieces of damsel fly, celtis warblers, reed warblers, sedge warblers, kingfishers and lesser spotted woodpeckers.
